Reviews.Title: “Decent place with poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: shimuelarivka
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: great location, big room, friendly cleaning staff. None of the problems we had were so egregious as to ruin our trip, but we ended up being pretty annoyed several times. Being nice and speaking spanish didn't seem to help with anything. On to the negatives. 1) When we arrived, they didn't have our reservation. Never happened to me with Expedia before, and from the reviews here it seems to be a common problem at this hotel. Makes me think it's their mistake. 2) When they found us a room, they told us it would be ready at 3pm (check-in time). We went for lunch and when we got back at 3:30, we had to wait until almost 4:30 for the room to finally be ready. 3) On our second morning, we had a tour booked that left at 7:30am. It was a full-day tour, so we asked to have our water bottles for the day that come with the room. Apparently we were not allowed to have the water bottles until 9am, so we had to go buy those on our own. For some reason, they are very stingy with the water. And we weren't even asking for anything extra. 4) The wifi was weak for most of the trip, but for the last two full days, it did not work at all. We told the woman at the front desk who said she couldn't reset the modem because she didn't know where it was. I guess nobody knew, since it didn't get fixed. 5) The beds were hard as rocks. 6) We had to get our keys reset about 4 times during our stay. 7) On checking out, the woman at the desk tried to charge us for 2 breakfasts. When we had checked in, the guy at the desk said, "Your breakfast is included. Here are your wristbands." And he put the wristbands on us. Only one of us had breakfast, just once, the entire stay. The breakfast was so-so, and we decided we'd get it elsewhere, so we took the wristbands off. The woman who was helping us check out actually did not believe that we had been given wristbands. She said things like, "Well, where are your wristbands now? Why would you take them off? If you took them off, where did you put them?" In the trash. We didn't know we would need to present them as evidence in the breakfast hearing. This was the last annoyance, and I'll admit, I stopped being nice. Luckily, they didn't take any of my credit card information on check in, so after refusing to pay extra for breakfast and telling her we were about to miss our bus, she coldly said, "Fine. Go." I won't stay there again. I certainly don't expect to be treated like royalty at a hotel like this, but a little courteousness could have gone a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems...”
Reviews.Author: Harry M
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself makes a nice impression, an attractive building, clean and well-kept. However, it is poorly managed, and there were problems. The rooms were spacious and nicely furnished, but our floor was quite dirty, and was never cleaned during our five-day stay. The water pressure was very poor. At one point the shower and faucet stopped working all together. After arguing for some time with the woman at the front desk, we were told it would be fixed in about 15 minutes. It was more like an hour and a half before it worked again, but the pressure remained very low our entire stay. At one point the heavy glass shower door fell off. This could have been catastrophic, but my daughter happened to be there to prevent it from crashing to the floor. Fortunately she wasn't hurt. Our phone didn't work. As others have said, if you are at the front of the hotel, it is quite loud at night well into the wee hours, so be prepared. We had a white noise machine which helped quite a bit. On the plus side, the building is very attractive, and within walking distance of everything. The pool is very nice. The on-site restaurant has decent food at reasonable prices, and there are literally dozens of good restaurants within close proximity. However, I would not recommend this hotel. I think you could do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Livingsocial made a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Guy_and_Gigs
Reviews.Content: We went on a Livingsocial Adventure in March 2012. Hacienda Real was the hotel where we stayed. Our room was spacious and clean. Very quaint. The bottled water left on counter every day reminded us to not drink from the tap! Our only complaint was that the beds were hard... way beyond firm. The hotel is very close to the beach and shops. Walking distance from the ADO (bus station) as long as you turn away from Juarez instead of going toward it. We got disoriented our first night and headed the wrong direction and ended up needing a cab. They are everywhere! The hotel restaurant isnt the best, but food is available any time of the day and night on 5ththe which is just a block away. If you get a chance to go to Playa, head over to 1st and 14th and head to the beach. On the left you will find a small bistro called Amaranto. The pancakes are fabulous and Romy will make you feel like a long lost friend. Very warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stole money from our room!”
Reviews.Author: 32emmy
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here. We had our cash stolen from our room by the employees of the hotel and they wouldn't do anything about it. We tried to report it but they did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy not happy especially with the management”
Reviews.Author: Hspo
Reviews.Content: We visit playa del Carmen and stay at the hotel for only a few days ( thank god) our travel agent book our hotel thought Expedia everything is pay for back home. When we check in our name is on but the girl at the front desk told us we have to pay again, she said Expedia don't pay then. (Don't book throught expedia it took our travel almost one hour to clear this mess up.)Uh you imaging the stress for us. The people there were not helpful at all. Anyway we end up paying cos we're in a new county and have our kids with us. It was a headache. Sink don't know what happen to the water went u turn it on was sooooo loud. My goodness, service very POOR, our room face the main street very loud. The music will be pumping up until 4am. Good thing our kids are sleeping thought it. Management never email us back we wrote them a letter. We saw this happen to a lot guest who are checking in. So please people if you are booking this hotel PLEASE read your review.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and were reasonably happy with this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The air-conditioning was effective and there was plenty of closet and storage space. We had a corner room on the 3rd floor, with balconies looking out on both sides. We were able to get extra towels when we needed them from the maid, and our room always had 2 bottles of fresh water. I was wary at first because I had seen reports of the hotel being noisy, but it wasn't that bad in my opinion. You are in the middle of a downtown area with an active nightlife, so you have to expect hearing some noise from the street outside. Pack some earplugs and you should be fine. The pool was beautiful, and comfortable for lounging and resting. The biggest selling point for this hotel is the location. You are 2 blocks from the beach, a block away from Av. 5, and a short walk from Wal-Mart if you want to stock up on snacks or cervezas. We never had to take a taxi the entire time we were in Playa, which was nice. The only complaints would be a lack of water pressure in the shower at times (only happened on our last day), and our safe did not work. We don't generally travel with valuables, but locking luggage can come in handy. Service was sometimes slow from the front desk and the restaurant. It is important to remember that you are in Mexico and to set your expectations accordingly. A friendly attitude and a little Spanish can go a long way, most people are very happy to help, but things do not happen at a pace that most Americans are accustomed to. I would happily stay here again when we return to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “What to avoid at Hacienda Real”
Reviews.Author: R O
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was adequate but for the money I think that you can do better. The rooms were comfortable and the maid service was good. When we arrived our room had no safe deposit box and they were unable to change our rooms. The front desk person, MARIANA, was both unwilling to do so and didn't really give a damn what our problem was. We experienced this from MARIANA several times during the visit. In fact she made our stay at the hotel uncomfortable enough that we will never return. Just the opposite was someone named Pedro or Pedri who went out of his way to help us and did so. So if you are visiting the Hacienda Real in Playa del Carmen enjoy but AVOID the person named MARIANA at all costs. She will make your life miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems”
Reviews.Author: oologah
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after having had family stay here last year, their biggest complaint was customer service was lacking. Unfortunately for us, they have slipped in several categories. Customer service is still bad, no towels for pool (washer broke) and staff is in no hurry to help or doesnt care. We stayed on third floor in room 320. Room was clean and cleaning staff was friendly. Hand towels were well worn and had tear or frayed edges. NO hot water, not really even warm, a cool shower was the best you got. Water pressure was weak, it came out of spray head in shower about 6 inches. One day there was no water pressure at all. The cable tv quit working for one day. Upon our arrival to check in we were told we did not have a room. They had us walk to their sister hotel on 4th. Our compensation was a free breakfast of their choosing. It was not as clean, but they did have hot water for a shower. Overall I rate this experience about a 3 on a scale of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little hotel with unfortunate neighbours.”
Reviews.Author: ceilidh400
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite pretty with a quaint inner courtyard & pool. The service was okay. They definitely need to update their linen, unless you like the colour grey. You cannot drink the tap water in the hotel but they do give you 2 500ml bottles of water each day. The beds were very hard and uncomfortable. Our room was spacious with a small fridge, hairdryer, ironing board and large walk in shower. We had a balcony overlooking the street which was nice for people watching. The hotel is VERY NOISY. Coco Bongo is half a block away and gets going at 11pm, then there is the regae party down the street that started at 1 am. The open to the street bar across the road does karaoke. The noise virtually didn't stop so bring ear plugs. I imagine if you asked for a room at the back of the hotel it might be quieter. It is fairly close to the beach so that is an asset. It may be inexpensive and quaint but I would not return there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...ROTTON service”
Reviews.Author: Dani G
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip through Living Social to stay at this hotel. Before our trip, I contacted the manager to book a two extra nights there. He said it was no problem and we could pay the balance when we checked in. At check in, (we arrived at 5:00pm on a Wednesday) we were told our room was NOT ready and would have to wait. I also asked about paying for our two extra nights and she said needed to pull it up on the computer and would call us once it was straightened out. 2 days went by and we never received a call, so Saturday we went back to the front desk and there was someone different working there (Pedro). I explained to him that we had booked 2 extra nights and needed to pay. Pedro was not able to pull up the reservations in the computer and said he needed to call the management office, which would not be open for another hour (This was around noon on Saturday) and were told to come back. We went out to eat and stopped back to check. Pedro told us he was able to get a hold of his manager and that everything was taken care of and our two extra nights were booked, but there was no vacancies for that night. I said that is fine...we are already booked here thru Sunday through Living Social and just needed Sunday night and Monday Night added and paid for. Pedro told me we could pay at check out on Tuesday morning. All was fine until 6:00 Sunday night. We came back from the beach to find the Maid service was only just then cleaning the room. We had to wait 40 minutes for her to finish before we could shower. While showering, the phone rang--it was Pedro asking us why we were still there and if we were staying, we needed to pay right away. We went down to the front desk and told him we talked to him yesterday and he said everything was booked. He told us he didn't remember. I repeated, we came down and talked to you yesterday afternoon. You called the manager and said we were fine and could pay the difference at check out. Again, conveniently, he didn't remember. He said if we wanted to stay we would need to change rooms. He showed me the computer and no one was booked in our room after us until Tuesday Night. I said, if no one is here until Tuesday, the day we are leaving first thing in the morning, why do we need to change rooms? After arguing with him for about 10 minutes, we were able to keep our room. When we asked how much we owed. First he tried to charge us for the entire time we were there, even though we had already paid. Finally, he figured $95 USD for the two nights. My boyfriend pulled out his card to pay and then Pedro said, "oh no, that will be an extra $40. I'm sorry." So we paid $135 USD and thought all was taken care of, until... Check out Tuesday morning. We had purchased bus tickets for 11:35. We were told check out was noon. We spent the morning walking around and went back to the room around 10:30 am and our keys did not work. We had to go to the front desk and get them reactivated and asked why. Pedro told us that we were checking out today and the keys were shut off. We asked why, if check out was at noon, would our keys not work at 10:30am? No answer. We went back to the room, packed up and went down to drop the keys off. When we checked out, Pedro told us he made a mistake and it would be an extra $80 USD for the room. Conveniently again, the managers office was not open and because we had to catch our bus to the airport, we handed over the debit card. He handed it back with a charge of $160 USD. I said to him, "You just told us $80 more... why are you double charging?" He said, "Oh, I meant $80 more per night." So all together we were charged $295 for only two nights. Now, I can't even get on the website to email or get a phone number of someone to speak to about this. We should have been told the amount we owed from the very beginning and not been given the run around by the employees. There were numerous other hotels around that would have been much cheaper for us to stay in. Next time, we will avoid this place and stay elsewhere. Like I said, if we would have been told an amount from the beginning and not had to fight almost every day of our trip about whether or not we had a room, this would have been a great experience. We've already complained to Living Social about it, so hopefully, they too, will take their business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: mctdenver
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at this hotel, but it was a very pleasant experience. Comfortable beds, clean room and access to the beach chairs at Wicky's. Overall a good experience and I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Average accomodations, good location for being in town”
Reviews.Author: marycairns56
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews prior to going on a Living Social trip, we were not surprised with our experience. We requested a quiet room prior to arrival, as the hotel location makes for night noise. Room spacious, clean. Linens desperately need to be replaced, as they are worn and gray.Breakfast average, at best. Staff pleasant and helpful. Deadbolt on our room was broken and never fixed, as was alarm clock. Courtyard charming with cold pool, as sun doesn't shine there. Easy walk to beach, with nice chairs and food service from resort hotel has use of. Location good for walking around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Onetrulove
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hacienda real and it was great. The location is excellent, close to the beach and 5th ave. We stayed with our 2 year old daughter and the room was big, clean, and the shower worked great! It is a bit noisy at night but it wasn't that bad because my daughter slept soundly every night

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location! I just need a room for sleep & showering!”
Reviews.Author: mizzkaki
Reviews.Content: Everyone complains about the noise. And yes, it is an issue if you are a light sleeper. The first night we arrived we were exhausted from traveling the entire day, but after checking in, and having dinner, we went out to party! By the time we got back to the room we crashed on the beds and didn't wake up until the next morning. You can hear everything that's going on on the hallways and the patio, but if you are as tiered as we were (we had day trips planned everyday!), you won't hear the noise. The beds were a bit hard. I didn't mind the hard beds though. The rooms are a decent size. There is enough storage space in the rooms for all your belongings. The area where the hotel is excellent! You are right in the center of La Quinta and just a block away from the beach. The staff was really friendly and helped us out when we had questions. I would stay here again if there weren't many options of where to stay, but if I go back to Playa, I would try somewhere else just for the sake of trying some other place and not because I did not like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They tried the "bait and switch", bad management/service problems.”
Reviews.Author: FoodLovrr
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I booked this hotel through Expedia. Upon arrival, we were told our room was unavailable due to bathroom issues. We were given a room at another hotel, which they promised was "just as nice." Of course, it was not. The staff at the other hotel was very nice, compared to this one, but the hotel was a cheap cinderblock kind of motel. After seeing the room, and repeated calls to Expedia (which were consistently dropped, btw), my husband was able to convince Expedia to convince the hotel to find a room. We retrieved our bags and checked in. We were blown away by how nice the Hacienda Real was in comparison. The happiness ended there. First, our shower smelled of sewage. Second, the housekeeping (although pleasant) was inconsistent. Most nights the room was cleaned when we were at dinner. We had to ask for, then later just take, towels. We also retrieved our own tissue and toilet paper when needed. Third, the restaurant staff was unhelpful. We paid for the American Breakfast upgrade. The first morning we arrived around 10 and it was dried up and half missing. The next morning we arrived around 7:30, which I would recommend. This time we had toast and regular sized plates! Service was still slow and I had to flag them down most times. Fourth, the "BeachClub Access" - I have no idea what that is. Despite the nice web site, the staff speaks little English. They explained where the beach access was (which hotel), but we ended up paying for a spot at a restaurant's beach instead. I am sure we missed out on something, but I could never find out what... Fifth, the street is very loud. DO NOT STAY HERE if you're a light sleeper. All of the in-town hotels are loud, I am sure. All in all it was a joke. The only saving graces were that it was inexpensive and the location was convenient. I would never consider "all inclusive" at this place, the local restaurants and bars are great and have good prices and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little place to stay right near downtown”
Reviews.Author: bebo23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place on our vacation at Playa de Carmen for 3 nights. We had a great experience. It was a cosy little place to stay. Our room was right by the pool so a bit noisy with the pool being used even post 9pm. The hotel was very close to Ave 5 which is the main street for shopping and dinning at Play de Carmen, just a 2 min walk. The beach was a 5min walk from the main street. The staff were very friendly. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “IMPOSSIBLE TO SLEEP!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tenntraveller1
Reviews.Content: We had a HORRIBLE experience at this hotel! There are three discos about half a block away, blasting loud music until 7:00 am! Don't even think about getting a good night's sleep at this place. To top that off, the central courtyard basically functions as an echo chamber. If anyone uses the pool at night (which doesn't seem to be against the rules) the noise will keep you awake! There were some other minor annoyances as well, which should be mentioned even though they pale beside the NOT BEING ABLE TO SLEEP issue: 1. There are only a few free parking spaces, so we had to pay US$17 at a garage down the street. 2. The staff was rude, except for the cleaning ladies, who seemed genuinely sweet. 3. We reserved two rooms, but at check in they told us that only one room was available due to a plumbing issue. One member of our party had to stay down the street at a different hotel, which cost $170 MORE than the Hacienda Real. The hotel staff was totally unhelpful during the whole process, and we wasted about three hours finding and moving our friend to another hotel. All in all, it was just a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loudest Hotel Ever...but it was clean and location is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for 10 days in December, just before Christmas. We were given room 304 and there we saw that the sink did not drain well. The first night in 304 looking out on the 10 Avenue, we were awaken to loud, drunken people who were coming out of Coco Bongos from 2:30am-5:30 am. Needless to say we asked to be moved the next morning. That was done and we ended up in room 319 (on the opposite side of the hotel) but still close to 10th Avenue. Well from that night onward we were woken and awake from 1 am-2am by singing drunk people in a small bar! I guess it was the better of the two so we didn't ask to be moved again. If you like sleep, don't stay here. The rooms were clean and the restaurant in the hotel was good, but the noise factor was awful-unless you are the one out at night instead of sleeping! ;) But the location is exceptional if you want to walk all over Playa del Carmen- the beach is a 1 minute walk, 5th Avenue is a 30 second walk, the ferry is about a 10 minute walk away to Cozumel, the WalMart is approximately 4 blocks away if you have to buy something you have forgotten. But again, if you value your sleep, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ve_blur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at this hotel. The only good thing was location. Everything else was a disappointment. The hotel looks pretty at first, but has many flaws. The rooms were big, we had two beds, but only one glass, one coffee cup, one chair. The towels were dirty, old, falling apart, they desperately need to be replaced. The beds and pillows super hard. Our room was not cleaned 2 days in a row. The first day the cleaning lady came at 7pm. After spending the whole day out at the beach, it was disappointing to come to an unkept room, when she finally showed up, we were getting ready for dinner and declined the service. The next day, they didn't even bother to come. We had to complain so someone will come clean our room!! The reception lady did not seem to have clear answers, they advertised we could use beach chairs and umbrellas from Wikys, but everytime we wanted to go there, the waiters were unfriendly and requested that we consume food and beverage. It seemed they were bothered by us and wanted only our money. There was no advantage being from the hotel, but a disadvantage. The hotel was loud as well. The location was excellent, close to 5th and the beach, but for the price we paid, we expected better service.

Reviews.Title: “So loud!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaGrimm
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very attractive and the rooms were lovely and big, BUT... It was so loud at night that you could not sleep. All the noise from the nearby bars could be heard all night. We could actually hear all the songs the guy was playing on his acoustic guitar from the bar down the street. I would not recommend staying there if you plan on sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Debi K
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the hcda Real, it is an ok hotel. It is old and could use some fine tuning. The room was adequate. We reserved a room with 2 queen beds, but got a small room with one queen bed. We faced the street, on the 3rd floor, and the noise at night was quite loud. The staff was friendly, but didn't seem well trained. The attached restaurant, while the staff here were very good, the food was mediocre at best. There is a coffee maker in the room, but for the fixins you must go to the desk and pay 5usd for the 2 cups of coffee! Free wifi, but if I didn't want to leave the room I had to sit on a pillow on the floor by the door to get it! The hotel is convenient to the beach and shopping, I'd prefer to walk a bit farther for a better room. No serious complaints, but I just wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...poor service”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a great spot. Arrival at the bus station and then a short walk to the hotel and shopping. The room was clean and comfortable, but the noise from the street was loud into the wee hours of the morning. We booked two nights, however when returned from shopping we were asked why we had not checked out. Seems they did not correctly input info in the computer. The second day returning from breakfast our key stopped working and that had to be corrected. At that point we decided we would not be staying at this hotel again. There are many other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Tired facilities and poorly trained staff”
Reviews.Author: MeridaOso
Reviews.Content: There was not one single thing bad enough to cause us to switch hotels, but we will not be staying there again. Check in was at 3, but the room was not ready until after 4:30. We reserved two queen-sized bed, but they only had single queen size beds available. They said that they assume that couples will sleep together. The A/C stopped working after the first day. The room door had to be slammed because it dragged on the floor. The dresser drawers would not close. There is a coffee machine in the room, but you have to go to the desk and pay $5.00 for a bag of coffee. After a day at the beach we returned to discover that the card keys no longer worked. Explaination - the cleaning crew deactivated the cards ???? The hotel is attractive but very tired - in need of significant maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “good location but the worse service in mexico”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: this hotel appeared great value for money. fair price, good location and well appointed rooms. but nothing worked and nobody cared. numerous little things - like no plug for the bath - answer "go look under the sink". nothing there - answer "here's an old one that nearly fits". the worse ones you just couldn't laugh about.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: Eyal_She
Reviews.Content: Playa Del Carmen was one of the cities we visited on our honeymoon. We weren't aware it was easter and when we did, we hurried up and order 2 nights at the hotel which was one of the last ones to have rooms available. The hotel is avarage, and a bit noisy because of the strange acoustics. The best thing about the hotel was it's great location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Sandraminnesota
Reviews.Content: We bought an all-inclusive package here, and the food was sooo good! It was all made to order, not buffet. You could ask for stuff off the menu too, if it was simple American stuff. The room was clean, it was so close to the beach, the mojitos were to die for. Just loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to the beach but really noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Mikkel_PS
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave a good first impression and was in good condition. The staff was accomodating and helpful and the cleaning was first class most of the time. When we checked in, our booking at Hotels.com did not seem to be recognized by the receptionist. She needed a print-out of out reservation (which was in Danish!) and when she checked us in, she missed the fact that breakfast was included. This mistake, however, was cleared out before the breakfast the first morning. After that, we had no further problems with the reservation. The first room they gave us was on the first floor. It only had a single window facing the passageway and smelled really bad of mold - probably due to the lack of ventilation and light from the outside. This was really a pity (we actually asked for a room with a balcony in one of the upper storeys when reserving through Hotels.com). Fortunately the receptionist agreed to give us a new room that met our expectations - on the second floor with a balcony facing Avenida 10. The room, the beds (two queen-size beds), the bathroom etc. were comfortable and in good condition. The location was great with 5 minutes walk to the beach and with a view from the balcony over Avenida 10. Not surprisingly, the air on the balcony was thick with exhaust and cooking fumes from the busy avenue, and the noise from the bars and the huge discoteque "Coco Bongo" could keep most people awake every night - prepared as we were, we brought earplugs and slowly got used to it. Without notice, the function rooms on the hotel's roof were used for a "special event" one Friday night - seemingly a really fun private party with a live salsa band, which probably kept a lot of hotel guests awake until 3 am. Our room was just below the function rooms, so we could not only hear the live music but also the high heels on the floor. Breakfast was served in the affiliated restaurant. We had ordered (and pre-paid) a "complete American breakfast" all mornings, which turned out to consist of toast with butter and jam, orange juice, coffee and an optional hot meal (hot cakes, scrambled eggs with bacon, Mexican scrambled eggs or "rancheros"). The breakfast was tasty and the service was generally good. Despite the complications upon arrival we were pleased with the stay and we had two really good weeks in Playa del Carmen. If you are sensitive to noise, however, we would recommend choosing a hotel with a less central location. Also, we will probably place our reservation directly through the hotel's website rather than booking at Hotels.com the next time we go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: lonltd
Reviews.Content: we came accross this hotel by accident having arrived early morning and had breakfast in their restaurant, very reasonable price and right in the centre of the down town area, the room had two queen size beds and we were lucky and got one of the few rooms with a balcony overlooking the pool. all the staff are absoloutly charming and helpfull. the rooms have great aircon and a fridgeand are very clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, location”
Reviews.Author: spenceratops
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a room here and enjoyed our stay. We payed the same amount at other places that had a lot less to offer. This place has a great location. Nice pool in beautiful private courtyard. Cool old world charm. Biggish rooms with decent beds. Helpful staff with good attitude. Downsides: they were out of pool towels at one point, didn't have coffee for the coffee maker in our room (there is a starbucks around the corner). We had to get the maintenance guy to put the drain-plug in our bathtub and show us how to use the safe (wouldn't have been possible to figure it out with an explanation). Bottom line: if you want great value in the heart of the tourist zone in Playa. I would guess that this place is one of the best deals around.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with all amenities for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: backpackinginheels
Reviews.Content: in search of a nice hotel that could provide me with a comfortable, clean bed and a quiet night i booked a room at this hotel via hotels.com for a great price. service here was consistently prompt and friendly, we slept like babies every single night and much enjoyed everything from the location to the very nearby main street as well as the pool and the charming decor of the place. i do recommend asking for a quiet room, as some of the rooms that lead on to the street can be noisy. overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avg room, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: creep1974
Reviews.Content: Booked one night online for a very good price under 100us. Hotel staff was helpful, spoke perfect english, and helped me get going on free wireless. Location is right off 5th ave the main drag and easy walking distance to beach, ferry pier, restaurants and bars. The pool is OK, but small and not in sun (courtyard). Room was clean but very simple, bed was hard and my room was on 1st floor by staff closets etc so it was very loud. beds not that comfortable but OK. I've heard you can walk around and bargain in playa but it was too hot and I had my girl and my bags. If you have the time/energy to save a few bucks that might be kinda fun. other wise this hotel is pretty good, not great for the money. The location is very close to ADO bus and all shops bars beach is the main attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but TOO NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: CDMN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hacienda Real del Caribe is a clean, quaint hotel. It is located one block off 5th and two blocks from the beach. It has three floors surrounding a courtyard with a nice, clean pool in the middle. The restaurant is just OK. The rooms are well-equipped including a wall safe, mini fridge, coffeemaker (coffee supplied at an additional cost – go to Wal-Mart down the street and buy coffee & coffeemate), table & chair, alarm clock, hair dryer, shampoos, etc. The bed was very comfortable, although some of the bedding has seen better days. The air conditioning worked well. The shower pressure was great with lots of hot water. Beach towels are available at no cost. The hotel offers a beach club; however, you have to spend 150 Pecos for use of their chairs/umbrellas, which is not hard to do – one bucket of beer (5) and the food was good. We stayed in room 220 which faces Calle 10. There is a pub, La Ranita Bar, directly across the street that reaches it’s peak action between midnight and two in the morning. Unfortunately, the window pane of the balcony doors provides absolutely no sound barrier and as such, we did not sleep between these hours. We tried ear plugs but they were uncomfortable. We could have asked to move to an interior room however, we did like to people watch over morning coffee and afternoon beers. To compensate, we snoozed on the beach or at the pool. If this would bother you, request an interior room. Rooms facing 10 Ave would have a similar issue with the Night Club, Coca Bonga, located closeby. For this reason, only, I’m not sure if I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place with almost all you need”
Reviews.Author: bilikenct
Reviews.Content: I just returned last night from this hotel and all I can say is "it's a great bang for the buck " The place is imaculate, staff is outstanding, and the location is excellent. The only and I mean only thing they need is a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Many problems.”
Reviews.Author: almac7
Reviews.Content: Maybe we had a particularly bad room, but the room we did start with had many problems: no towels, inoperable lock on the door, patio door and safe. We then asked for another room. This room had the same poorly washed towels and sheets (do they use bleach?) The next day our room wasn't cleaned in the afternoon. I've stayed at dozens of hotels and have lived in Playa, but this was a first. I had to call the Front Desk to have them bring fresh towels up. I'd like to think they're still a relatively new hotel, but I'd stay away from this one until they get it right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: cozydiver
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from an 11 day adventure in Cancun, Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel. After Cancun we booked a couple night at Hacienda Real and my wife and I were very pleased. Its clean, and the location is perfect. Couple blocks from the beach and maybe 50 yards from 5th Ave which is the main strip in PDC. I would return in a second for the price. Cute hotel and very romantic. No gripes at all. The two ladies I delt with at the front desk were very pleasant. Thumbs up for me!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet atmosphere a stone's throw from 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: davidahrens
Reviews.Content: We typically avoid the large, all inclusives opting for small, quiet boutique hotels. We found Hacienda Real a perfect choice. It's only a city block away from the main pedestrian way (5th Ave) and two city blocks from the beach. At the same time however, it is very quiet and serence due to an open interior which surrounds the pool. We spent several late afternoons relaxing by the pool as the sun slowly set. The staff was very professional and eager to serve their guests. The hotel also has a nice attached restaurant with good food and friendly wait staff. We would definitely stay there again on future visits to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for Quality & Value - Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: saramarsdenille
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days, and were distinctly impressed with this gem of a hotel. We found it through Expedia and it was superb value at $49 US per night. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were spacious, modern, well-maintained and impeccably clean. The bed was so comfortable, and we had some of the best nights sleep we have had for ages! The hotel is is a good location, close to the beach and within walking distance of most places. The courtyard with the swimming pool is very pretty and a real little retreat area. My only criticism of this place is that the food in the restaurant was not particularly good. However, for anyone looking for a fairly small, friendly and nice place to stay in PDC, I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: fetuskarate
Reviews.Content: So let's break it down: The staff is helpful and friendly, the rooms are nice and clean, the place has character, and it's in the middle of everything. The pillows are soft (although I'm pretty sure I don't need 5,000 of them), the pool is refreshing, and there's free wifi. The restaurant connected to the hotel is good too. On the down side, it's on a main street so there's a lot of traffic noise and occasional drunken wailing at night, some of the rooms can smell like smoke (we switched out of one that did), internet doesn't work on some parts of the top floor, and the sheets are sometimes in questionable condition (cigarette burns on my pillow? Ew). But these are small tradeoffs, because a stay at this hotel is worth it. I don't know what it is about this place, but from the outside sometimes and once you enter the pool courtyard, it smells amazing! Like, floral and pretty. Does that sound weird?

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: NoliG
Reviews.Content: Pros: location can not be better, 1 block from Quinta Avenida and 2 blocks from the beach. Convenient store and drugstore across the street, tons of restaurants around the area. Staff are very friendly. Rooms with high ceilings, comfortable bed and tons of pillows--from soft to hard. Heated tile floor in bathroom. Awesome pool. Free WIFI. Cable TV. They even let me do a late checkout since my shuttle was scheduled to arrive at 1:45 pm. Cons: Small things-- keycard gets deactivated every night so after a couple of nights, I just pass by the lobby to get my keycard reactivated. Water pressure not so great but just enough to take a shower. They always forget to give an extra towel since there were 3 of us in the room. Overall I am so glad I stayed in this hotel. It is a newer hotel right smack in the center of Playa. Never had any problems with sleeping-- I stayed on the ground floor facing the courtyard/swimming pool. The bed is comfortable and temperature control in the room is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: mira4581
Reviews.Content: This hotel had more flaws then comforts and we would not stay here again. The hotel's design is architecturally flawed, there is a courtyard in the middle with a pool, surrounded by hotel rooms on all four sides, three floors high. Any sound is amplified when it echoes off the four walls. We asked for the quietest room because based on previous reviews we did not want a room looking out to the street. We were placed in an inner room on the first floor. Although there are posted pool hours, they are not enforced. Kids splash and jump into the pool until about 12am and then the drunks come from the clubs and socialize there until 4 am. Then, night employees of the hotel hang out in the laundry area, which is right next to the guest rooms on the first floor and talk until about 6am. From 6-10am is when you should expect to sleep. After complaining to the management, nothing was done. In addition to the noise, the doors do not fit properly into the door way and there are cracks about half an inch wide in some spots, this obviously adds to the loudness at night. The towels are in bad shape, the beds and pillows are hard as bricks. The bedsheets had old blood stains on them in one of the beds, they clearly do not throw out old linens and they smelled like they do not bleach them. This hotel is pretty at first sight, but the craftsmanship is poor. Also, the floor in the bathroom of our room was always hot because a sewer ran under it and the open run-off drain stank like sewage. I would not stay here, the only reason it has four stars is because of it's deceptive facade, when you look closer it is at most a 2 star experience. Finally, we hung a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door so that no houskeepers would wonder around our room while we were gone- they took it off several times and proceeded to make our beds anyway. There is no respect to the guests in that hotel. There is free Wi-Fi, and it is located a two blocks from the beach, and one block from 5th Ave where all the stores and restaurants are located.

Reviews.Title: “Plan on getting no sleep if you're staying here!”
Reviews.Author: chloeb29
Reviews.Content: The location is great if your up for a party...the hotel is right in front of coco bongos. However, if you plan on sleeping I'd choose elsewhere. When we checked into the hotel we had specifically asked for a room not on ave 10, only to be told by the lady at reception that they had a "special system" for noise reduction (non-existent!). We stayed 4 nights (booked and paid for in advance, we would have left after the first sleepless night otherwise) and had our room made up each day, the sheets were not changed once! despite there being obvious yellow stains on the sheets prior to us using them. The hotel looks great from the outside and the rooms are beautiful, but the hotel is poorly managed and is in need of a real noise reduction system

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: djchen1228
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. The boutique hotel is clean and comfortable and full of local charm. The lobby and pool / Spanish courtyard areas are great for lounging and taking a breather from the bustle of the city. Rooms are straightforward and well-kept with modern fixtures/decor and comfortable bedding. Rooms face the courtyard. Cable TV with a couple English channels. Staff is friendly and helpful. Location is great, just a 3-minute walk from the main avenue. Parking included. WIFI available but is patchy. Warning: There is sister hotel by the same name located right off of Avenida 5 & Calle 2. DO NOT come here. This location seems comfortable enough from the outside--has a similar layout, and quaint pool & courtyard. Rooms have a local Mexican decor and may seem charming when flooded with daylight, but quickly reveals its dinginess by night. Fixtures are older with chipped walls, dim, florescent lighting, and scant bedding. By scant i mean no comforter, just a sheet and a thin bed cover. Also i started getting bites on my legs while sitting in bed and had to switch to another room. Windows look out into dirty alleys for a dismal view. I came during a storm, and found the room is not very good at keeping out moisture. Floor was consistently damp. i went to sleep with a damp floor and believe it or not, when i woke up the floor was even more WET. Btw i was on the 2nd floor. Service here is friendly, but does not make up for the uncomfortable stay. Btw- one evening in July was $44

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereLeastOnce
Reviews.Content: We moved here from another hotel. The hotel and room was clean. We had wifi in our room. We had plenty of hot water, but the water pressure was low. But everything else was great. I recommend getting a inner room facing the pool. Some of these rooms have balconies over the pool (very nice). Plus you go a free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in PDC”
Reviews.Author: Virus
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel in the center of Playa Del Carmen. An easy walk to the beach, shops, restaurants and nightlife, and also the bus station. Our Deluxe Room ($90 ex tax through Booking.com) on 2nd floor faced the street so you did get to hear all the traffic and people sounds virtually all night through. It's only a minor quibble though as overall, the room had enough space for the three of us, was super clean and beautifully furnished; the beds very comfy. The shower was very big (no tub), water pressure excellent, towels nice and fluffy. Quick check-in, efficient and professional service, except for the restaurant. We went there for breakfast which was very basic - coffee/tea, orange juice, toast and butter/jam and waited a good 10 minutes to be served, with no other patrons and seemingly idle staff. The pool, although not big, was good and open until 9pm. The hotel also provides beach towels. Would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel in a central location with high compfort level.”
Reviews.Author: johnnydarock
Reviews.Content: I walked in here with my wife and two kids and got a double room for $70. The comfort level far exceeded my expectations: beautiful room, comfortable beds, air conditioning that works, polite staff and great pool. One block off the main drag with tons of great restaurants and shopping...and another block to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: saladbits
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Real del Caribe is a very lovely full service hotel. Located centrally in Playa del Carmen, the hotel provides a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle that Playa has become. Yes, the hotel is on a the busy corner of Calle 10 at Avenida 10, but once the windows and sliders were closed the room was literally noise proof. Testament of this was that during our stay there were several Carnaval events and street fairs taking place in the municipal complex; continuing to late night/early morning, the noise level was not a problem, at all. This is particularly eventful as our room was the directly on the corner. My only area of concern is that a situation with our suite's air conditioner was not rectified in good time, nor satisfactorily until our "negotiator" finally went to management and requested our room be changed, after a most uncomfortable night's sleep. The hacienda setting, with a nice sized pool in the courtyard, is very quaint and comfortable. Interior courtyard rooms have hacienda windows which open out into the courtyard. The pool is well maintained and has full-service from the onsite restaurant. Service is above extraordinary and most welcomed. A bucket of beer is brought out in a champagne bucket... I like that style! We dined lunch at the pool and enjoyed, very much, the food and service. Meals: the continental breakfast included is coffee, OJ and toast. Some mornings we would have a full breakfast on site and, again, service is exemplary. Front desk service is accommodating, cleanliness of the rooms above average. Beds are the usual hard beds but linens are very high quality. There is an assortment of pillows available, as well. Bathrooms include shampoo, conditioner, soap, body lotion, hair dryer, magnifier mirror. There is an in room safe, iron and ironing board. On another note, the rooftop would be a lovely spot for a destination wedding or celebration. There is an enclosed solarium, which looked quite large, and has a wonderful sea view. The high season price is a bit high, but considering the location and hotel amenities Hacienda Real del Caribe is a good value, especially for families or friends sharing a suite.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: reginaldleeadams
Reviews.Content: We lucked into the Hotel R d Caribe after a night at another spot that didn't work out for us. My girlfriend just walked in and they had rooms available for us at a good rate. The hotel has a nice pool, and seems brand new. It is "international style," ie, big rooms, lots of faux marble, not a lot of Yucatcan cultural touches. The room was very comfortable and very clean, and the bathroom was huge. We found the desk to be very helpful and personable, and the free loaner towels saved us money when we went to the beach clubs. The hotel is just a block off of 5th Av, and we liked the fact that it was a bit quieter, while still being very close to the action and to a number of good restaurants. If you want a quieter room, be sure to ask for one not on 10th Av, but instead on the inner courtyard. The free breakfast was pretty skimpy, but there are lots of good bfast places nearby, so we just used it as a way to get some toast and a first cup of coffee before heading out to the beach. Our only issue was on our last day there, when we had them hold our passports for safe keeping, and when we arrived at the agreed upon hour in the afternoon, the manager wasn't around, and they couldn't enter the room with the safe. They ended up taking apart a window and getting in that way, but we spent a nervous 45 min worrying we'd miss our flight back to Mexico City.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Hacienda Real del Caribe
HotelInfo.Address: Av. 10 Calle 10 Norte | Col. Centro, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
